Module contents¶

mfm.math.linalg.angle(a, b, c)[source]¶

The angle between three vectors

Parameters:
  • a – numpy array
  • b – numpy array
  • c – numpy array
Returns:

angle between three vectors/points in space
mfm.math.linalg.cartesian(arrays, out=None)[source]¶

Generate a cartesian product of input arrays.

Parameters:
  • arrays – list of arrays 1-D arrays to form the cartesian product of.
  • out – 2-D array of shape (M, len(arrays)) containing cartesian products formed of input arrays.
Returns:

2-D array of shape (M, len(arrays)) containing cartesian products formed of input arrays.

Examples

>>> cartesian(([1, 2, 3], [4, 5], [6, 7]))
array([[1, 4, 6],
       [1, 4, 7],
       [1, 5, 6],
       [1, 5, 7],
       [2, 4, 6],
       [2, 4, 7],
       [2, 5, 6],
       [2, 5, 7],
       [3, 4, 6],
       [3, 4, 7],
       [3, 5, 6],
       [3, 5, 7]])
